Material used.Description: HEK293 cells (ATCC, Manassas, VA, USA) were maintained in DMEM media supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (Hyclone, Logan, UT, USA).

Readout description.Conclusion: Cells expressing wild - type LRRK2 were more tolerant to H₂O₂ toxicity than those expressing Y1699C or G2019S mutants
Readout description.Result Description: Cells expressing wild - type LRRK2 experienced 50% attenuation in H₂O₂ - induced cell death relative to those cells expressing Y1699C or G2019S mutants

Biological replicates.Description: All values in the figures were calculated from at least 2 - 3 independent experiments

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment containing at least 6 - 8 replicates in each experimental condition

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Results are reported as mean value ± SEM. The significance of difference between means was assessed by ANOVA and post hoc Fisher's protected least significant difference (PLSD) tests, with p<0.05 considered statistically significant.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells (ATCC, Manassas, VA, USA) were maintained in DMEM media supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (Hyclone, Logan, UT, USA).

Readout description.Conclusion: Chronic treatment with 150µM of H₂O₂ resulted in 10% of necrotic cell death
Readout description.Result Description: Necrosis was characterized by early loss of cell membrane integrity and the release of cytosolic lactate dehydrogenase (LDH). LDH release was measured to quantify necrotic cell death induced by MPP⁺

Biological replicates.Description: All values in the figures were calculated from at least 2 - 3 independent experiments

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment containing at least 6 - 8 replicates in each experimental condition

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Results are reported as mean value ± SEM. The significance of difference between means was assessed by ANOVA and post hoc Fisher's protected least significant difference (PLSD) tests, with p<0.05 considered statistically significant.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Cell count post - stained with Hoechst stain

Material used.Description: SH - SY5Y cells, a kind gift from Dr. James P. Bennett Jr, University of Virginia were maintained in DMEM media supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (Hyclone, Logan, UT, USA).

Readout description.Conclusion: Cells expressing LRRK2 wild - type experienced a 27 - 36% lowering in cell death as compared to cells expressing Y1699C or G2019S respectively
Readout description.Result Description: The percentage cell survival was determined by direct cell count of cells exhibiting GFP fluorescence against total cell number visualized by Hoechst stain

Biological replicates.Description: Data are means ± SEM, 3 readings per data point, from at least three independent experiments

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Results are reported as mean value ± SEM. The significance of difference between means was assessed by ANOVA and post hoc Fisher's protected least significant difference (PLSD) tests, with p<0.05 considered statistically significant.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells (ATCC, Manassas, VA, USA) and SH - SY5Y cells (a kind gift from Dr. James P. Bennett Jr, University of Virginia) were used.

Readout description.Conclusion: The presence of wild - type LRRK2 and Y1699C mutant in HEK293 cells was visualized. Also, changes in basal levels of pERK and pJNK were determined
Readout description.Result Description: Standard PAGE and Western blotting protocols recommended by Cell Signaling Technology (Danvers, MA, USA) were used
